column5: Headed out at 1 am ... started fishing by 3:30am  ... fish till 5:00am  ... nothin so I hit timmies and decided to have a little nap before light ... started fishing again at 7:00 am ... washed several lures then at 8:00 tap ... miss ... cast to the same spot didn't miss this time ... almost dropped my net in the water with the winter gloves on ... suprised no one else was fishing in the morning ... nice little 2lbr... next cast another tap .... 2 casts later a bigger eye .... after about 20 min I changed up lures from taildancer to the manns Dr. Death ... first cast a pike just smoked it not more then 6 ft from the edge of the pier ... fished till 11 without a sniff ... got some lunch and another nap and back at it at 3pm .... it was raining and windy now and didn't even get a tap ... some of the locals showed up at 3:30ish and didn't have any luck either .. at 5 I called it a day ... here are some pics

Wow!! Great haul...especially for this late in December.  Great work!!! Us shore fishermen have to stick together...it's great to see success like this.  Thanks for takin the time to post...nice pics!
Sounds like a full day of shore fishing, thanks for posting the report...  Mike
Gotta love those power naps.   Nice report, sport.
Great report you caught a few fish ate and slept well and now a little bit of fish to fry at home and you went home relaxed and rested .Good for you Man .Mike

I'm sorry but I have to ask, what lake is the Boq ??? I have seen all kinds of reports from there but have no clue !! Before you make fun of me remember I am 1000 kms from Toronto !! I have been to shy to ask and just can't take it anymore..  WHERE O WHERE IS THE BOQ ????????  Thank's Medic
BOQ is the Bay of Quinte.  Nice report, man I love eating pike.

BOQ= Bay of Quinte.  This map will help you out.  I'd be surprised if anyone made fun of you for that question.....it's a legit question...it took me forever to figure out that GB was Georgian Bay.....
Thanks guys, kind of a hard one to miss. Looks like it would be awesome to fish!!  Merry Christmas!!
great report BFG,way to go nice catch too,there will be a nice fish-fry there instead of turkey dinner a pike & walleye dinner mmmmmmm- yummmmyyyy

It was interesting in the late 80's and early Nineties. That was b4 the z-bra mussells cleared up the water. Them ole walleyes would come in an stay awhile in the relative (8-12') shallows. I remember 60 fish days.  Lotsa a small (1/4 lb) ones, but there were a few big ones thrown in the mix. It was a different fishery than what it has now become.
